name: Get Started with QGIS
description: Simple introduction to the desktop GIS interface, QGIS.

name: Georeference a Map
description: Brief notes on the status of MapWarper, and the best way to get started georeferencing.

name: Clip Data by Geographic Extent
description: Step-by-step tutorial on clipping GIS data to a desired extent.

name: Symbolize by Value
description: Step-by-step tutorial on changing the style of data features based on their stored attribute characteristics.

name: Edit Existing GIS Data
description: Notes on using QGIS to edit existing vector data.

name: Set Up a Mac with GIS Software
description: Installation guide for mapping on a mac. Includes Homebrew, Python and other mapping tools.

name: Set Up a PC for Python and GIS Libraries
description: Step-by-step tutorial on configuring a virtual environment to be able to use various geospatial Python libraries on a PC.

name: Use Python to Work with GIS Data
description: Workshop activity for cleaning data and making a web map using Python, Geopandas, and Nominatum.

name: Common GIS File Formats
description: Notes on properties of common geospatial file formats.

name: Massachusetts Aerial Photography
description: Background information on aerial photography made available for Massachusetts and notes on how to work with it in QGIS, ArcGIS Online and Leaflet.

name: Massachusetts Property Boundaries
description: Background information on parcel and property data made available for Massachusetts and notes on how to work with it in QGIS.

name: Create an Annotated Map Story
description: Step-by-step tutorial on using the LMEC's annotation web tool to tell stories with digital map collections.

name: Bring Atlascope Tiles into Your Map
description: Background information on BPL urban atlas tiles created by LMEC and notes on how to work with them in QGIS, ArcGIS Online and Leaflet.

name: Geotransform Urban Atlases
description: Internal best practices and process notes for transforming individual atlas plates into stitched, tiled web layers using open source software.

name: Use the Atlascope Portal
description: Background information on the Atlascope project and instructions on how to use the web tool to browse historical urban atlases.
